title: Add CalendarMembership API endpoints
description:
Add REST API endpoints for managing calendar memberships.

## Endpoints
- GET /api/calendars/:id/members - List members
- POST /api/calendars/:id/members - Invite user
- PATCH /api/calendars/:id/members/:user_id - Change role
- DELETE /api/calendars/:id/members/:user_id - Remove member

## Authorization
- owner: full access
- writer/reader: view only

Blocked by: DynamoDB repositories

title: Create shared types crate for client/server contracts
description:
Extract request/response DTOs into a shared crate to ensure type safety between client and server.

## Problem
Currently duplicated types between:
- crates/client/src/client/*.rs (CreateCalendarRequest, UpdateCalendarRequest, etc.)
- crates/calendsync/src/models/*.rs (CreateCalendar, UpdateCalendar, etc.)

## Solution
Create crates/api_types/ with:
- Request types (CreateCalendarRequest, UpdateEntryRequest, etc.)
- Response types (if different from core types)
- Query parameter types (ListEntriesQuery, etc.)

## Changes Required
1. Create crates/api_types/Cargo.toml
2. Move request/response DTOs to shared crate
3. Update calendsync to use shared types
4. Update calendsync_client to use shared types
5. Remove duplicated type definitions

## Benefits
- Single source of truth for API contracts
- Compile-time guarantee that client and server agree on shapes
- Easier API evolution

title: Add membership CLI commands to calendsync-client
description:
Add CLI commands for managing calendar memberships.

## Commands to Add
calendsync-client memberships list --calendar-id <UUID>
calendsync-client memberships add --calendar-id <UUID> --user-id <UUID> --role <owner|writer|reader>
calendsync-client memberships update --calendar-id <UUID> --user-id <UUID> --role <owner|writer|reader>
calendsync-client memberships remove --calendar-id <UUID> --user-id <UUID>

## Output Formats
Support both --format json and --format pretty

## Dependencies
Blocked by: calendsync-fb6 (API endpoints must exist first)

title: Create shared types crate for client/server contracts
description: Extract request/response DTOs into a shared crate (crates/api_types/) to ensure type safety between client and server.

title: Implement DynamoDB repositories to replace in-memory AppState
description:
Replace the current in-memory AppState storage with DynamoDB repositories.

## Context
- DynamoDB table schema is defined in docs/dynamodb.md
- Table deployment via cargo xtask dynamodb deploy
- Seed data via cargo xtask dynamodb seed
- AWS SDK already integrated in xtask/src/dynamodb/

## Tasks
1. Create repository traits in calendsync_core
2. Implement DynamoDB repositories in calendsync
3. Update AppState to use repository traits
4. Add configuration for DynamoDB connection

## Access Patterns (from docs/dynamodb.md)
- Get user by ID
- Get calendar by ID
- Get entry by ID
- Get all users for a calendar (with roles)
- Get all calendars for a user (with roles)
- Get entries for calendar within date range

title: Add membership CLI commands to calendsync-client
description: Add CLI commands for managing calendar memberships. Blocked by: calendsync-14w

title: Replace simulated SSE events with real event bus
Add CalendarMembership API endpoints
description:
Add REST API endpoints for managing calendar memberships (inviting users, changing roles, removing members).

## Endpoints to Add
- GET /api/calendars/:id/members - List members with roles
- POST /api/calendars/:id/members - Invite user to calendar
- PATCH /api/calendars/:id/members/:user_id - Change member role
- DELETE /api/calendars/:id/members/:user_id - Remove member

## Authorization
- owner: can add/remove members, change roles
- writer: can view members only
- reader: can view members only

## Models
CalendarMembership type already exists in calendsync_core:
- calendar_id: Uuid
- user_id: Uuid
- role: CalendarRole (Owner, Writer, Reader)
- joined_at: DateTime<Utc>

## Dependencies
Blocked by: calendsync-l3a (DynamoDB repositories)

title: Remove hardcoded ssr state
description: Update the `new_with_warmup` function found on the ssr crate to consume the `initialData` from the caller, and not hardcode a state inline

title: Add Docker setup for local DynamoDB
Remove hardcoded ssr state
description: Update the `health_check` function found on the ssr crate to consume the `initialData` from the caller, and not hardcode a state inline

title: Implement DynamoDB repositories to replace in-memory AppState
description:
Replace the current in-memory AppState storage with DynamoDB repositories.

## Context
- DynamoDB table schema is defined in docs/dynamodb.md
- Table deployment via `cargo xtask dynamodb deploy`
- Seed data via `cargo xtask dynamodb seed`
- AWS SDK already integrated in xtask/src/dynamodb/

## Tasks
1. Create repository traits in calendsync_core:
   - UserRepository
   - CalendarRepository
   - CalendarEntryRepository
   - CalendarMembershipRepository

2. Implement DynamoDB repositories in calendsync:
   - DynamoUserRepository
   - DynamoCalendarRepository
   - DynamoCalendarEntryRepository
   - DynamoCalendarMembershipRepository

3. Update AppState to use repository traits instead of RwLock<HashMap>

4. Add configuration for DynamoDB connection (env vars already documented)

## Access Patterns (from docs/dynamodb.md)
- Get user by ID
- Get calendar by ID
- Get entry by ID
- Get all users for a calendar (with roles)
- Get all calendars for a user (with roles)
- Get entries for calendar within date range

## Architecture
Follow Functional Core - Imperative Shell:
- Repository traits in calendsync_core (pure interfaces)
- DynamoDB implementations in calendsync (imperative shell)

title: Add User and CalendarMembership types to calendsync_core
